title: Pan- Seared Tilapia
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Pan- Seared Tilapian a try. One serving contains 427 calories, 69g of protein, and 15g of fat. This gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian recipe serves 1 and costs $6.64 per serving. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 7 minutes. A mixture of parsley, tilapia fillets, juice of lemon, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so yummy. To use up the dairy free margarine you could follow this main course with the Peanut Butter Coconut Oatmeal Scotchies as a dessert. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 84%. This score is excellent. Similar recipes include Healthy Sheet Pan Tilapian and Veggies + Meal-Prep, Pan-Seared Eggplant with Buttermilk Dressing, and Pan-Seared Tuna Steaks with Tomato Spinach Sauce.

winePairing.pairingText: Tilapia works really well with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Chehalem 3 Vineyard Pinot Gris with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 26 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Chehalem 3 Vineyard Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: A blend of three great vineyards, this vivid grape crafts a food-friendly wine, bright and pure. Gray it isn't. The knife-edged acid, with pear, lemon sorbet, spice and jasmine makes your mouth water and your hands shake.
